title: Republicans warn of pain ahead as US shutdown faces its second week
subhead: Most federal operations remain shuttered, with no signs of ending, as Republicans and Democrats continue to disagree about expiring Obamacare health subsidies. The country's last government shutdown in 2018 cost the US economy an estimated $11 billion.

title: The EAT-'Lancet' commission outlines a fairer global diet for feeding the planet sustainably
subhead: A study published on Friday in 'The Lancet' finds that food systems are a major driver of environmental degradation, rising chronic disease and growing inequality. The report calls for a shift toward less meat-heavy diets and a more equitable distribution of value along the food chain.

title: French museums continue to court American donors amid uncertainty
subhead: Although French cultural institutions fear that Donald Trump might abolish a tax deduction enjoyed by American 'friends of' associations, they have continued to court US patrons.

title: The making of the Agnès b. cardigan
subhead: Since its creation in 1979, the Agnès b. snap cardigan has sold more than two million pieces. Functional and timeless, it has been produced in more than 150 colors and 40 versions, immortalized by world-renowned photographers and even exhibited in museums.

title: Three hours in Gaza City, an ocean of ruins emptied of its people
subhead: Le Monde's Jerusalem correspondent entered the Palestinian urban area for a few hours on Friday, October 3, under escort from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). The territory, largely destroyed by airstrikes and bulldozers, was utterly deserted, with nearly all residents having fled south within the enclave.
byline: By Luc Bronner (Gaza City, special correspondent)
